input: What does Section 106 of the IPC define?
target: Section 106 allows the right of private defense, even at the risk of harming innocent persons, if there is no other way to protect oneself.

input: Does Section 106 justify harm to innocent persons?
target: Yes, but only if it is unavoidable and necessary for self-defense.

input: What is an example of defense under Section 106?
target: Throwing a heavy object at an attacker in a crowded space, accidentally injuring a bystander, is protected under Section 106.

input: Does Section 106 apply to property defense?
target: No, Section 106 applies only to the defense of life and body.

input: What is the significance of Section 106?
target: Section 106 ensures the right to self-defense even in complex situations where harm to innocents is unavoidable.
